text:
Un endroit tres Zen et calme une adresse qui pour reste une des meilleurs dans la province de Quebec.
Les prix pour un repas complet entre 10 et 20 cad dollards, carte des vins tres riche avec et les prix en relation une cartes comme cela est vraiment des plus ageable. Il manque un sommelier et la c'est le grand luxe!!!
Je recommande chaudement

Je suis allés souvent à Mikado Monkland et avant j'allais souvent à celui de St.Denis.D'abord, il y a une différence dans la qualité des sushis, celui de St.Denis étant un peu bien meilleur.Aussi, leur menus sont un peu différents car certains  mets sont faits par un chef et pas l'autre.En tout cas, je le trouve de moins en moins bon le restaurant sur Monkland:trop de riz dans le sushis, trop de sel aussi.Je me sens trop lourde et je ne savoure pas les sushis. Et pour le prix qu'on paye, je suis certaine qu'on peut avoir mieux.

Great Montreal-style sushi. They have various locations that offer different house speciaties, but their 'Chardonnay', 'Paradise' and 'Relax' rolls are really outstanding.


 They also offer take-out and delivery
Great sushi, great cosy seating. Service is very courteous and non-pretentious. Highly recommended

Split the dumplings as a starter,  ok, but I have had better.   Had the Seafood, Udon Noodles, Teryaki dish which was good,  although teryaki is not my favorite type of preparation.  Partner had Steak Teriyaki which was excellent.   

Next time I will try the Tempura dishes.

Service was excellent,  very attentive.

Ughhh is a no for me! The sushi is ok, mtl all you can eat quality, but the price is not right. For the same price you can get far better. I got the sashimi plate they don't let you choose what fish is on it, and the selection on the menus is quite limited. The sashimi was a bit dry so... It wasn't cut fresh and was prob sitting out... I would skip this one!

Les meilleurs sushis au monde ! d'un raffinement et d'un goût sans pareil.
Ils sont divins...... et c'est peu de le dire, je ne crois pas que je trouverai 
d'aussi bons sushis, nulle part ailleurs.  Je les recommande sans réserve, 
ils sont plus que succulents, jamais décevants.  Ils marient l'art et le savoir
faire, les saveurs sont un vrai festival.  Honnêtement: délicieux-savoureux-
succulents-etc.  Je n'ai aucun lien professionnel ou personnel avec ce 
restaurant, je l'assure, et ces compliments, ils les méritent réellement ! 
FÉLICITATIONS.

So so delicious! Small restaurant, so the food came relatively fast and the service was great! Dumplings and salads are so great to start, and the sushi is just perfect! The NDG and Titanic are awesoke combinations! You can also ask for them to serve it on boats(:

Over priced, flavourless and small.
Very unimpressed.
With so many amazing sushi places its sad that so much money was spent on less than mediocre product.
Food didn't taste fresh at all... Sadly disappointed

Defiantly not the best or ok sushi place in montreal. It's unfortunate for a place like monkland that counts on the locals to keep the business going. They also have great summer activities around. It has changed over the years and not for the better. Fish to rice ratio was poor. The flavor was not even impressive. Just when I though you can't mess up kamikase they did ! (Where is the salmon!) the tempura stuck to ur teeth and well I can't say much about the fish since I couldn't find it .. 
the soy sauce was also on the salty side, more than usual.. 
the service  was good and polite.. 
there is a nice patio, street view .. 
Price was ok and fare 
Quality was nothing special 
I won't come back unless there are some menu or chef change ..

Les sushis étaient très bons, super frais et bien exécutés. Il était difficile d'arrêter de manger même lorsque nous n'avions plus faim. Nous avons aussi eu droit à l'assiette de sorbet et celle de crème brûlée, et tout était délicieux. Je recommande fortement. Seul hic, pour moi c'est loin d'où je vis et je n'est pas nécessairement le type d'ambiance que je recherche côté musique et déco mais pour la "bouffe" thumbs up
Had a great meal, cozy restaurant.The sushi was very good.

Yum! I live in San Francisco so I know from good Japanese food, and I try to make Mikado a stop whenever I'm back home.

Last time I was in town, I took my folks. Dad had a Chicken Katsu that would have had him licking the platter if it hadn't been so hot. Mom and I sampled some of the ngiri & sashimi, and didn't find one clunker in the bunch.  Their use of green apple in the maki was new to me (I generally eat only at traditional Japanese restaurants) but was lovely.  I always make a point of trying rolls I haven't had before when I can, and Mikado always has a selection of new ones, including ones that the kosher among us can eat. (Most places' rolls are all eel and crab, so MIkado's wide variety of rolls that are fish, fruit, vegetable and tasty sauces are a pleasure and delight.)

I've heard mutterings elsewhere about Mikado being "expensive." Cheap, they aren't. But expensive is relative, and I've had Japanese food that cost a lot more and tasted a lot worse. But we're talking about RAW FISH. You get what you pay for - do you want a well-kept restaurant where the food is excellent and you know you'll walk out healthy, or not?

My one complaint is that they have to be a tad more careful with the miso soup. They serve two varieties, one of which has shellfish in it. That's not the one we ordered - guess which we got?
Les assiettes vraiment gouteuses , decoration  fancy, bon service , serviette en tissus mais les baguettes cheap .. trouver l'erreur lol , en somme toute bonne experience.
